body: Wich `libngtcp2_crypto*` libraries have been built in your /home/p/ngtcp2/build` tree?

It looks like the following:

```
#> fd ngtcp2_crypto build/
build/include/ngtcp2/ngtcp2_crypto.h
build/include/ngtcp2/ngtcp2_crypto_ossl.h
build/lib/libngtcp2_crypto_ossl.a
build/lib/libngtcp2_crypto_ossl.so
build/lib/libngtcp2_crypto_ossl.so.0
build/lib/libngtcp2_crypto_ossl.so.0.0.0
build/lib/pkgconfig/libngtcp2_crypto_ossl.pc
```

```
checking for pkg-config... (cached) /usr/bin/pkg-config
checking for libngtcp2 options with pkg-config... found
configure: -l is -lngtcp2
configure: -I is -I/home/p/ngtcp2/build/include
configure: -L is -L/home/p/ngtcp2/build/lib
checking for ngtcp2_conn_client_new_versioned in -lngtcp2... yes
checking ngtcp2/ngtcp2.h usability... yes
checking ngtcp2/ngtcp2.h presence... yes
checking for ngtcp2/ngtcp2.h... yes
configure: Added /home/p/build/lib to CURL_LIBRARY_PATH
checking for pkg-config... (cached) /usr/bin/pkg-config
checking for libngtcp2_crypto_ossl options with pkg-config... no
configure: error: --with-ngtcp2 was specified but could not find ngtcp2_crypto_ossl pkg-config file.
```
Pinging @vszakats as he's been tinkering in this area recently.

My understanding is that all detections using the pattern
`export PKG_CONFIG_LIBDIR=<custom-path>` [^1] to look for
a component at that custom path, may be affected by this.
The issue is when the component has a dependency that's
not found at a default, system, location, because setting
`PKG_CONFIG_LIBDIR`, makes the classic `pkg-config` tool
ignore `PKG_CONFIG_PATH`, which may point to those
transitive dependencies.

Question how to tell pkg-config to look in `custom-path`
preferably first, while respecting other custom locations set
by the parent env. In a way that works with both classic
`pkg-config` and `pkgconf`.

`pkgconf` doesn't ignore `PKG_CONFIG_PATH` in this
case, so it should work (according to the documentation).
But it _appends_ the custom LIBDIR to PATH, so it won't
be looking at it first. Which might still be okay, hard to say.

Tried a [couple of ideas](https://github.com/curl/curl/pull/18028/commits), without success, while working on
the ref-ed commit.

edit: While figuring out a fix, adjusting the documentation
would be nice of course.

[^1]:

https://github.com/curl/curl/blob/cb9b1a4c4e875ac4eac2209d8686acef3114abdf/acinclude.m4#L1376-L1381

issue.title: HTTP3.md: avoid `configure` issue for ngtcp2 1.14.0+ compatibility

issue.body:
Applied the same workaround to the build examples as used earlier in CI.
That is, drop `<path> from `--with-ngtcp2=<path>` and configure env
`PKG_CONFIG_PATH` instead.

Till the root cause is fixed.

Ref: 99500660af19f89069e71c2251c13963401b3806 #18028

Reported-by: Pavel Kropachev
Fixes #18188

issue.title: Build failure with ngtcp2 OpenSSL backend: wrong configure_client_* symbol

labels.name: not-a-curl-bug
labels.description: This is not a bug in curl

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
### I did this

```
CC       vtls/libcurl_la-openssl.lo
vquic/curl_ngtcp2.c: In function 'cf_ngtcp2_tls_ctx_setup':
CC       vtls/libcurl_la-rustls.lo
vquic/curl_ngtcp2.c:2321:6: error: implicit declaration of function 'ngtcp2_crypto_quictls_configure_client_context';
did you mean 'ngtcp2_crypto_ossl_configure_client_session'? [-Wimplicit-function-declaration]                  
2321|   if(ngtcp2_crypto_quictls_configure_client_context(ctx->ossl.ssl_ctx) != 0) {
    |      ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    |      ngtcp2_crypto_ossl_configure_client_session
CC       vtls/libcurl_la-schannel.lo
CC       vtls/libcurl_la-schannel_verify.lo
CC       vtls/libcurl_la-vtls.lo
make[2]: *** [Makefile:4751: vquic/libcurlu_la-curl_ngtcp2.lo] Error 1
make[2]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
CC       vtls/libcurl_la-vtls_scache.lo
make[2]: Leaving directory '/root/curl/lib'
make[1]: *** [Makefile:1661: all] Error 2
make[1]: Leaving directory '/root/curl/lib'
make: *** [Makefile:625: all-recursive] Error 1
localhost:~/curl#
```

### I expected the following

Root cause:ngtcp2_crypto_quictls_configure_client_context exists only in the quictls backend.For OpenSSL backend the correct symbol is  ngtcp2_crypto_ossl_configure_client_session , which expects  SSL *  instead of  SSL_CTX * .

### curl/libcurl version

curl 8.14~New dev

### operating system

Alpine on arm64
localhost:~/curl# uname -a                                                  Linux localhost 5.10.233-dirty #1 SMP PREEMPT Mon Jul 14 03:57:41 UTC 2025 aarch64 Linux                                      localhost:~/curl#

issue.title: Issues building curl with http3

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
### I did this

Hi, i followed this same steps for build curl for having support with http3: https://curl.se/docs/http3.html

I ended up using the combination of openssl3.3.0+quic.

Versions of other modules downloaded as source but seems to give same result if git clone is used:

https://github.com/quictls/openssl/releases/tag/openssl-3.3.0-quic1
https://github.com/ngtcp2/ngtcp2/releases/tag/v1.17.0
https://github.com/curl/curl/releases/tag/curl-8_16_0

Git cloned:

nghttp3

The steps followed was like that:

```
cd openssl
./config --prefix=/home/user/openssl/huh1 --libdir=lib
make
make install
```

nghttp3:

```
cd ..
git clone -b $NGHTTP3_VERSION https://github.com/ngtcp2/nghttp3
cd nghttp3
git submodule update --init
autoreconf -fi
./configure --prefix=/home/user/nghttp3/huh2 --enable-lib-only
make
make install
```

ngtcp2:

```
cd ..
cd ngtcp2
autoreconf -fi
./configure PKG_CONFIG_PATH=/home/user/openssl/huh1/lib/pkgconfig:/home/user/nghttp3/huh2/lib/pkgconfig LDFLAGS="-Wl,-rpath,/home/user/openssl/huh1/lib" --prefix=/home/user/ngtcp2/huh3/ --enable-lib-only --with-openssl
make
make install
```

curl:

```
cd ..
cd curl
autoreconf -fi
LDFLAGS="-Wl,-rpath,/home/user/openssl/huh1/lib" ./configure PKG_CONFIG_PATH=/home/user/ngtcp2/huh3/lib/pkgconfig --without-libpsl --with-openssl=/home/user/openssl/huh1 --with-nghttp3=/home/user/nghttp3/huh2 --with-ngtcp2
make
```

Issue starts after that last make, giving at end:

```
make[1]: Entering directory '/home/user/curl/src'
  CCLD     curl
/usr/bin/ld: ../lib/.libs/libcurl.so: undefined reference to `ngtcp2_crypto_client_initial_cb'
/usr/bin/ld: ../lib/.libs/libcurl.so: undefined reference to `ngtcp2_crypto_recv_retry_cb'
/usr/bin/ld: ../lib/.libs/libcurl.so: undefined reference to `ngtcp2_crypto_delete_crypto_aead_ctx_cb'
/usr/bin/ld: ../lib/.libs/libcurl.so: undefined reference to `ngtcp2_crypto_delete_crypto_cipher_ctx_cb'
/usr/bin/ld: ../lib/.libs/libcurl.so: undefined reference to `ngtcp2_crypto_quictls_configure_client_context'
/usr/bin/ld: ../lib/.libs/libcurl.so: undefined reference to `ngtcp2_crypto_encrypt_cb'
/usr/bin/ld: ../lib/.libs/libcurl.so: undefined reference to `ngtcp2_crypto_get_path_challenge_data_cb'
/usr/bin/ld: ../lib/.libs/libcurl.so: undefined reference to `ngtcp2_crypto_recv_crypto_data_cb'
/usr/bin/ld: ../lib/.libs/libcurl.so: undefined reference to `ngtcp2_crypto_hp_mask_cb'
/usr/bin/ld: ../lib/.libs/libcurl.so: undefined reference to `ngtcp2_crypto_decrypt_cb'
/usr/bin/ld: ../lib/.libs/libcurl.so: undefined reference to `ngtcp2_crypto_update_key_cb'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
make[1]: *** [Makefile:1051: curl] Error 1
make[1]: Leaving directory '/home/user/curl/src'
make: *** [Makefile:620: all-recursive] Error 1
```

Those functions seem to be on ngtcp2 project but for some reason are not referenced correctly when performing make on curl side.

If more information is required, just let me know.




### I expected the following

make command should create a libcurl.so without reference issues of any kind.

### curl/libcurl version

https://github.com/curl/curl/releases/tag/curl-8_16_0

### operating system

Linux debian 6.1.0-40-amd64 #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Debian 6.1.153-1 (2025-09-20) x86_64 GNU/Linux
